reviewText:
I will first say that this is a sidescrolling game with colelctables in the game and can be played in a couple different ways. Its style of game is you shoot with the mouse(point and click). this game has a good amount of flashing lights on one of the beginning levels. you do not have to play levels in any order, but need a certain amount to get the boss of that world. Overall the game was enjoyable so far and I will continue to play it.

other random thoughts:

its an indie game and feels well made EXCEPT when I went to select wasd after loading it up after the first time and it was still set to the arrow keys, and after it was fixed the options menu said it was the arrow keys.

The gameplay seems solid, the backgrounds on one level i noticed moved with you, similar to the original rayman,

I will post screenshots of this game so more people can see more of this game.

reviewText:
Cartoon style dark and bloody adults shoot 'em up game
This is great fast pace sidescrolling game where you are vampire that is trying to change into back human. You encounter several types of enemies that will either do you damage by running into you or shoot bullets.

You can complete these levels in different styles

- Getting fastest complete time
- Shooting all enemies
- No damage
- Find all collectables
- Find all powerup boxes


Controls:  With mouse point and shoot   or   Pick up controller and shoot with stick

Pros

- Works on low-end computers
- Great comic story
- Bloody cartoon style!
- Level selection map is marvelous
- Great enemies
- Fast pace gameplay!
- Time leaderboards for each levels
- No bugs encounter

Cons

- Too much writting on screen sometimes
- Only shotgun


Future update reccomendations

- Ability to find new clothes on levels?
- More weapons

Conclusion: Very unique and deep cartoonish artstyle game! With great levels and many ways to beat levels!

Hardware what I used

Hardware        Type                Model        Acer ICONIA 6120 Dual-Screen Touchbook 14                Controller        Xbox one Lunar White                OS        Windows 10 pro 64bit            CPU        Intel i5 M480 @ 2.67GHz            RAM        8GB DDR3             HDD        600gb HDD"

reviewText:
I want to be human is an action platform shooter hybrid with an indie soundtrack and a very interesting aesthetic. The story of I want to be Human describes itself as Boy meets vampire girl, boy falls in love with vampire girl, boy gets turned into a weaponised hat by evil forces trying to take over the world… wait, what? There is only one thing a vampire girl can do: go on a bloodthirsty rampage of death and destruction in a quest to get her boyfriend back!... OK

The game itself is kind hard to explain. Think a shooter like Contra, crossed with elements of a hardcore platformer like Super Meat Boy but with elements of bullet hell shooters thrown in.

As you travel through the game’s levels each award you a grade and a score by collecting items, breaking score blocks and killing things. Every time you break a block or kill something a combo meter increases which of course in turn increases your overall score. The key to an excellent score is in keeping an ongoing chain of kills and blocks going as you progress through the game’s levels.

This is easier said than done and while the early levels of the game are not difficult to get through to gain a good score is actually very difficult without repeated playthroughs.
Every few levels are met with a boss fight that mix things up a bit and a welcome change of pace.

Mechanically the game plays generally well with a contra style control system mixed with super meat boy style wall jumping platforming. There is also a dash move that was rather fiddly to control with accuracy and I felt was rarely needed except in the aforementioned boss fights.

So do I like the game… Yes... I guess I appreciate its merits but I must admit not being a massive fan of score attack twitch platformers some of the game’s charm I feel is a little lost. After completing the game’s first world I was desperate for a new gun rather than just an upgrade or some different mechanics.  While there are different worlds and themes each level looks very similar and the enemy variety is also a little lacking.

Visually the game is pretty to look at but I feel a slightly higher resolution in the sprites wouldn't have gone amiss. The soundtrack of the game is excellent providing a thumping indie soundtrack including original tracks from Jimmy Urine of Mindless Self Indulgence.

Whether or not you enjoy this game will largely rely on whether you know what you are getting. This is very much not a run and gun game and sits most comfortably as a Super Meat Boy, score attack game with some shooting elements thrown in. Its good I just feel there could have been a little bit more variety to keep me coming back for more but is it’s a score attack and surprisingly hardcore game you are looking for this will fit the bill nicely.

THE GAME WAS PLAYED USING A KEY PROVIDED BY THE DEVELOPER. MY THOUGHTS AND OPINIONS ARE HOWEVER MY OWN. THE PRICE OF THE GAME HAS BEEN TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT WHEN PRODUCING THIS REVIEW.

For our video review please check it out here:  Video Review[www.thegametutor.co.uk]

http://www.thegamerholics.com/want-human-review/

Check out my review at the link above!  I was provided with a code to review this game.

TL:DR - Blood soaked 2D platforming head-banging shotgun badassery await in this uniquely styled creation from Sinclair Strange, that you need to buy RIGHT NOW.

reviewText: To read my full review, visit MouseNJoypad; http://mousenjoypad.com/reviews/pc/want-human-review/\n\nI’m not going to mince words- I did not enjoy my time with ‘I Want To Be Human.’ Outside of the game’s buggy and outdated gameplay, it lacks anything memorable or interesting enough to keep anyone's attention for very long. Sure, it’s quirky- but it's that kind of humor that’s weird for cringy sake. If you can get past the poor controls and frustrating level design, there are plenty of fun battles to be had. Sadly, I can’t recommend this game to anyone- it just feels far too amateurish, and it’s even more disappointing when I see the work this one-man team has put out before.

reviewText:
Product received for free

I review games for my website Nardio.net. I recieved a free promotion key for I Want To Be Human a little while ago when we were covering games at Pax East. To see the review with pictures that go to the link below. The text of the review is below. I know this is a harsh review, but this a really bad game.

http://nardio.net/2016/05/24/want-human-review/

Is I Want To Be Human worth your time?
No.





What should I play this on?
I played/endured this on a PC with an X-Box controller.



What Did We Think Without Spoiling It?
This is a let down. I Want To Be Human is just a bad platformer that sells for a comically high price. Even if the game were free I would hate it. Seeing it sell for $14.99 on Steam is mind blowing to me.



How it Plays and Why it Fails:
Bad game design.

I love action platformers. I love interesting art. I love energetic music. I Want To Be Human should be a darn insta-recommendation from me. I was really, really excited to play this game. When we received a promotional key for the game I was giddy. Sadly and honestly quite painfully, horrible level design knee caps the game. I Want To Be Human is painfully bad game all around.

Ugh.

This was a frustrating game to play and even more frustrating to try and like. I want to be Human is just a bad game. I know I already said that, but I feel like I can’t say it enough. The art seemed really interesting when I first started it up, but soon enough the flaws started to make themselves known. Often times foreground visual junk totally obscures the on screen action. I know this happens a bit here an there in some games, but it’s taken to an unforgivable extreme here. You just cannot see some enemies that are attacking you on the ground. You can’t even see yourself!


In areas like this it’s just about shooting and hoping you get the kill.  I want to be human has more problems than just foreground clutter, but that is the last thing that bugged me before I decided to uninstall the game and give up on it. I Want To Be Human has so many problems I think it patching here and there can’t fix it. This game needs to be taken down and totally rebuilt from the ground up. There is a good game in here I am sure, but it’t covered and covered in problems.

Lets go into some of it’s problems shall well?

Cheap enemy placement.
Randomized enemy projectiles.
Bad level design.
Bad aiming control on a game pad.
Visual clutter and bad in game lighting makes platforming and finding enemies unnecessarily difficult.
Stupid text bubbles that constantly appear from the players mouth that interfere with your view of the game. (CAN’T SHUT THIS OFF!)
Horrible bouncing camera.
Way to much unnecessary screen shake. (CAN’T SHUT THIS OFF!)

I Want To Be Human is just a bad game.


It feels like I Want To Be Human is the developer’s very first game. It feels as if the dev took every new technique they learned and over used it all for fun. Then decided to sell it without cleaning the game up at all. Mechanics, enemy placement, and overall game design seems to have no concern for the player playing the game. I don’t think this was ever play tested. I Want To Be Human plays that badly.  Why are text bubbles constantly coming from the character that blocks everything underneath it? Why can’t I shut that off? Getting knocked off a cliff by enemy bullets I can’t see because my character can’t stop calling dead enemies eight year old insults is beyond stupid. This is not an issue that should be in a game that sells for this much. Heck this shouldn’t happen at all ever in any game. That is just bad game design.

If you hate screen shake you are going to despise this game. Even if you don’t have a problem with screen shake this will bother you. As I was playing/enduring this Jasmine (Who has no problem with screen shake) was watching me play and felt ill after a while. I Want To Be Human is really that painful and uncomfortable to watch.

I really tried to get into it, I completed several levels and spent over an hour playing it, but it never felt fun and the level design only gets more frustrating. I got this game for free as a review/promotional copy and I hated it. This is in no way shape or form worth the $14.99 asking price.

Don’t get this game even if it’s free.

reviewText:
Got this game for review.
Firstly, it's an action platformer shooter with quite a black humor and surrealistic setting.

The gameplay relies on style point so you get the point.

The game has its set of issues like it get's repetitive quite quickly at times and that the framerates occasionally dip but irrespective of it, I would say that the game is pretty good thanks to its beautiful soundtrack.

Should I reccomend it ? Yes.
Should you buy it ? Ofc you should. But it would be wiser if you purchase in sales.

Full review- http://techarx.com/review-i-want-to-be-a-human/
